title.narrative: Stöd till Världsbankens Country Environmental Analysis Tanzania
Support to World Bank Country Environmental Anlysis Tanzania

description.narrative: The World Bank will during 2017-2019 undertake a so called Country Environmental Analysis (CEA). CEA is a process the World Bank does together with Tanzanian public partners to identify main Environment and sustainability challenges. The purpose of the work is partly to assist the country get an overview of pressing environment and sustainability challenges and how to address them, partly to inform the World Bank about possible interventions they can support. CEA is a standard tool the World Bank undertakes in many countries and does this mostly by itself in cooperation with the country´s authorities. The Swedish Embassy was invited to participate however, mainly due to good relations and cooperation in the sector. Sweden has good capacity particularly in environmental economics which in discussion with the World Bank was identified as a suitable area Sweden could support with expertise in. Particularly the Department of Economics at the University of Gothenburg has unique competence and experience in environmental economics from a development context perspective as well as long experience of cooperation with the World Bank, not the least from several CEAs. The contribution therefore intends to enable key staff at the Department of Economics at the University of Gothenburg, including staff from their partner institution Department of Economics at the University of Dar es Salaam, to participate in the World Bank´s CEA for Tanzania during 2017-2019.

Världsbanken genomför 2017-2019 en s.k. Country Environmental Analysis för Tanzania. Det är ett arbete tillsammans med Tanzania för att identifiera de övergripande utmaningarna i landet vad gäller miljö och hållbarhet. Syftet med arbetet är dels att hjälpa landet få en överblick av miljösituationen och hur olika miljö- och hållbarhetsproblem kan hanteras, dels att ge information till Världsbanken om möjliga områden de kan stödja i Tanzania. Country Environmental Analysis är ett standardinstrument Världsbanken genomför i flertalet länder och genomför oftast detta arbete själva tillsammans med landets myndigheter. Svenska ambassaden blev dock inbjudna att delta, mycket pga gott samarbete inom området. Sverige har mycket god kunskap, framför allt inom miljöekonomi vilket i samtal med Världsbanken identifierades som lämpligt att bidra med i arbetet. Särskilt Institutionen för nationalekonomi med statistik vid Göteborgs Universitet har unik kompetens vad gäller miljöekonomi i ett utvecklingsperspektiv och lång erfarenhet av samarbete med Världsbanken, inte minst med flertalet Country Environmental Analysis. Insatsen avser därmed att möjliggöra för nyckelpersoner inom Institutionen för nationalekonomi med statistik vid Göteborgs Universitet, samt från deras samarbetsinstitution Department of Economics vid University of Dar es Salaam, att medverka i Världsbankens Country Environmental Analysis i Tanzania 2017-2019.

The objective of the intervention is to support the World Bank's Country Environmental Assessment process in Tanzania. Sida's support enables the World Bank to add to the process, e.g. on important topics such as environmental economics. It also enables the use of several local researchers from University of Dar es Salaam. The intended outcome of the project is an updated State of the Environment report from Tanzania and several indepth policy notes on key environmental topics.

tag.narrative: 15.1 - By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements.

15.1 - Till 2020 bevara, återställa och hållbart använda ekosystem på land och i sötvatten och deras ekosystemtjänster, särskilt skogar, våtmarker, berg och torra områden, i enlighet med de skyldigheter som anges i internationella överenskommelser.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: A comprehensive state of the environment report was published in 2018. The report was well received and the Tanzanian government, e.g. the Environment Department (the ministry), has had good use of it in their subsequent reporting and communication. The process of producing the report was also valuable with many tanzanian participating organisations, both public and non-government, contributing. As of mid-2020, an indepth policy report is about to be finalised on the topic charcoal. The issue of charcoal is important in Tanzania, with impacts on local economy, on health and livelihoods on energy use and not the least impacts on the environment. The Government is struggling to address the serious negative impacts of charcoal in Tanzania. The policy report on charcoal is aimed at helping central and local government addressing some of the difficulties with the use of charcoal in Tanzania.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
